div.l: Ȝif eủer sythus I hyht hogge of ware
Herd I a myller bet set awerk
He had a Iape of malis in þᵉ derk
And þ̉erfore ȝif ȝe fouche saf to here
But god Forbede we stynte here
A tale of me þat am a pore man
I wyl ȝow telle as well as I can
A lytel Iae þᵗat fell in oure Citee
Oure ost seyde I gᵃraunt hit þe
Now tell on Roger loke þᵗat hit be gode
For many a past hast þᵘou lete blode
And many a Iakke of doủer hast þᵘou sold
Þat hath be twyes hote ⁊and twyes cold
Of many a pylgrym hast þᵘou cⁱristes cors
For of þi ꝑpersel ȝyt fare I þᵉ wors
Þᵗat I haue ete wᵗith þᵉ stubbed goos
For in þy shop þ̉ere is many a flee loos
Now tell on gentel Rog̉er be þy name
But ȝut I pᵃray þe be not wroth for game4354
Þᵘou seyst ful soth qduod Rog̉er by my fey 4356
Þᵘou seydest not a sother word to dey Spurious
But sooth pley is pley as Flēmmyng seyth4357
And þ̉erfore herny bayly by þy fayth
Be þᵘou not wroth or we departyn here
Þauh þᵗat my tale be of an hostelere
But neủerþeles I wyl not telle hit ȝyt
But or we depart I wys þᵘou shalt be quyt
And þ̉erwᵗithall he louh ⁊and made cher
And seyde his tale ȝe shull her 4364
